701280f-b.title: Bronx: Hollywood Avenue - Schurz Avenue
701280f-b.text:
Hollywood Avenue. east side, from Schurz to Harding Avenues,
showing the St. Frances De Chantal Roman Catholic Church.
August 15, 1940
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr

701278f-a.title: Bronx: Hollywood Avenue - Schurz Avenue
701278f-a.text:
Hollywood Avenue, east side, between Schurz Avenue and the
East River, directly within the grounds of the Silver Beach private
Nreal estate development, showing the Robert House. It was built by
the founder of Robert College, Constantinople. It is now (1937)
known as the Cooper House, after James Fenimore Cooper, the renowned
author, who lived and worked here on some of his books. The house
is still inhabited and is said, by its present owner, to be about
170 years old.
1906
Gift of -andall Comfort
701278f-a.folder: Hollywood Avenue & Schurz Avenue, Bronx, NY

701279f.title: Bronx: Hollywood Avenue - Schurz Avenue
701279f.text:
Hollywood Ave., east side, between Schurz Ave. and the East River
(directly within the grounds of the Silver Beach private real estate
development), showing the Robert House. IIt was built by the founder
of Robert College, Constantinople. It is also called the James Fenimore
Cooper House, after the renowned author who lived and worked here for a
number of years. The house is still (1938) inhabited and is said, by
its present owner, to be about 170 years old. The view shows the house
after it has been renovated.
June 1926.
Brown Brothers.
701279f.folder: Hollywood Avenue & Schurz Avenue, Bronx, NY
